parentDescriptions: This screening evaluates your child’s physical development, including movement, coordination, and hand-eye skills.
Helps identify early motor milestones and areas where your child may need support.
A simple assessment to understand your baby’s physical development.
Designed to observe early movement patterns and coordination skills.
Supports early identification of motor skill delays.
Evaluates how your baby moves, reaches, and responds physically.
Focuses on early gross and fine motor abilities.
Provides insight into your baby’s developing strength and coordination.
Encourages early awareness of physical growth and movement skills.
questions: Can your little one lift their head while lying on their tummy?
Does your baby move both arms and legs equally?
Can your little one grasp your finger or a small toy?
Does your baby bring their hands to their mouth?
Can your baby briefly hold their head steady?
Does your baby kick their legs freely when lying down?
Can your baby track objects with their eyes?
Does your baby open and close their hands?
Does your baby respond with movement when you interact?
Does your baby show smoother, controlled movements?
